intro: Gagea pratensis var. paczoskii, commonly known as the Paczoskii spring beauty, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of Europe. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped white or pale pink flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils in woodland or grassland habitats. Its leaves are basal, linear, and often persist through the winter, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
